item.title: Ticket #2613 (Don't show private posts on front page) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Patch removes private posts from front page query and adds caps for editing/deleting/reading private posts and pages. Admin is given these caps by default. No other role can read/edit/delete other user's private posts.

item.title: private.diff attached to Ticket #2613
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: No private posts in main query. Add private post/page caps.

item.title: Ticket #2711 (Bookmarklet instructions should be browser specific) created
item.dc:creator: mplace
item.description:
This suggestion comes from one of our [www.xmission.com] users and credit for this discovery should be given to <locutus@…>:

Just a suggestion... maybe customize some of the interface text for different browsers.

For example, the Write Post page contains the following text:

=========== WordPress bookmarklet

Right click on the following link and choose "Add to favorites" to create a posting shortcut. ===========

Since I use Firefox on Linux, what I should choose is not found. Hence, maybe detect the browser, and add the relevant text?

I.e., on Firefox, it's "Bookmark this Link..."

item.title: template-functions-category.php.diff attached to Ticket #2710
item.dc:creator: janX
item.description: Diff to release version 2.0.2 of the file

item.title: Ticket #2710 (list_cats / wp_list_cats: hide_empty does not hide cats with non-empty ...) created
item.dc:creator: janX
item.description: I'd like for the hide_empty options in list_cats and wp_list_cats to NOT hide categories which are empty, but that have sub-categories that have posts in them. Looking at the code it is obvious why this happens (template-functions-category.php, line 322). I have a fix for this, though.

item.title: Ticket #2702 (Easier way to change page order (AJAX/jQuery?)) updated
item.dc:creator: FireMotion
item.description:
Another suggestion to make life easier:

In Edit Page maybe there could be the Move Up / Move Down buttons, in addition to the existing input box. Having those buttons is more user-friendly for anyone. Especially for clueless newbies.

item.title: Ticket #2709 (Category query cleanups) closed
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
fixed:

(In [3767]) Category query cleanups from skeltoac. fixes #2709

item.title: Changeset [3767]: Category query cleanups from skeltoac. fixes #2709

item.description: Category query cleanups from skeltoac. fixes #2709

item.title: Ticket #2708 (Setting Last-Modified causes intermittent blank pages) updated
item.dc:creator: masquerade
item.description:
Thank you for the explanation. It remains a curiosity that any other header can be set in the wp_head action without causing this issue---perhaps a bug that WordPress allows that---but I accept that the better-supported hook is init.

Not possible, please read ​http://php.net/header

item.title: Ticket #2708 (Setting Last-Modified causes intermittent blank pages) updated
item.dc:creator: peterjanes
item.description:
Thank you for the explanation. It remains a curiosity that any other header can be set in the wp_head action without causing this issue---perhaps a bug that WordPress allows that---but I accept that the better-supported hook is init.

As for your point b), obviously I'm very aware that the code I posted is not in the codebase, but as I stated it was my belief that it triggered (and still triggers) a bug in the WP code. Consider the messenger shot.

item.title: Ticket #2704 (new hook request) closed
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
worksforme:

template_redirect should suit your needs just fine.

item.title: Ticket #1303 (new script for importing posts from Blosxom (import-blosxom.php)) updated
item.dc:creator: cshbell
item.description: This script works great (thanks!) but I can't figure out how to get my writebacks to appear as part of the rss20 feed so that the script finds them. My rss20 feed only displays posts, not their associated writebacks. Did I miss something in the documentation?
